attributes.action: urge Birmingham City Council to continue to use the apostrophe where appropriate on road signs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Birmingham City Council is proposing to drop apostrophes from its road signs. Apostrophes are used to convey missing letters and signify possession of an object or idea. 

The rules surrounding use of apostrophes, unlike other punctuation marks, are clear. To cease to use them where appropriate will change the meaning that is intended to be conveyed.
